content:
Neat Stuff On The WEB!

 Name:Wendy Cheng
E-mail: easu517@ea.oac.uci.edu
Major: Biology and Psychology

Three neat Web finds:

  1. For a look at some really interesting (and famous) paintings that are available on the WEB, click Famous Paintings to look at them.

    To see a self-portrait and a little bit of history behind Impressionist painter Vincent van Gogh, click Van Gogh to look at this.

  2. To get the latest weather update anywhere across the United States, click Weather Browser.

    For a glance at temperatures anywhere in California, click California.

  3. For a look at some really nice Fantasy Art, click Fantasy.

Questions I can now answer
  1. What does W3 define?
  2. What are the two main types of Internet connections and what are the differences between the two?
  3. What does the UCI College of Medicine have to offer?
  4. How many medical schools are there in the state of California? Which of these are within the University of California and where are they located?
  5. When is the X-files on T.V. (in Califormia) and where can I get additional information about this program?

  1. What does W3 define?

    W3, or the World Wide Web stands for a variety of things. According to T. Berners-Lee, one of the things W3 stands for is the concept that one can retrieve an array of information which have references by which they could be retrieved.

    The World Wide Web also has an address system (URI) which is incorporated so that one has a listing of the references, although many different protocols exist.

    There is also a network protocol (HTTP) which gives the performance and features which are not otherwise available. For a detailed definition of what HTTP is, click Hypertext Transfer Protocol.

    The WEB also uses a markup language (HTML), which serves the purpose of transmitting basic things across the net. For a more detailed definition of what HTML is, click Hypertext Markup Language.

    Return to list of questions.

  2. What are the two main types of Internet connections and what are the differences between the two?

    The two main types of Internet connections are     directand indirect connections. Both types use either modems or existing newtwork cards, and have a wide range of prices. The main difference between the two is that with a direct connection, the computer acts as an individual node on the Internet.

    With a direct connection, the computer has its own IP address, and it can be established as a server for FTP, Gopher, News, or the W3. By doing this, you can use the software available to bring in mail to your own computer. For programs such as Mosaic, one must use direct connections.

    Indirect connection, however, gives a disk space and access time on another computer. The mail received and transfer files stays on that server.

    Return to list of questions.

  3. What does the UCI College of Medicine have to offer?

     The UCI College of Medicine has alot to offer to its students. It has attracted internationally recognized researchers and clinicians. As a UCI medical student, you will have the opportunity to work with this distinguished faculty. UCI's growing stature as one of the nation's most prominent researchinstitutions offers medical students an opportunity to work with researchers and faculty who are the leaders in their fields.

    Also, the College of Medicine's principal clinical facility is the UCI Medical Center. Medical students can gain clinical experience at tow ambulatory care centers on the UCI campus--The UCI Medical Plaza and Beckman Laser Institute.

    Return to list of questions.

  4. How many medical schools are there in the state of California? Which of these are within the University of California and where are they located?

    At this moment, there are thirteen medical schools existing in the state of California. Of these thirteen, five medical schools are within the University of California. The five medical schools which are located within the University of California are at Davis, Los Angeles, San Francisco, San Diego, and Irvine.

    Click UCI Med for more information about admission at the UCI College of Medicine. ClickE-mail to send electronic mail to the UCI College of Admissions/.

    Return to list of questions.

  5. When is the X-Files on TV (in California) and where can I get additional information about this television program?

    The X-Files

    "The X Files" airs on Fidays at 8 p.m. on FOX and lasts for an hour. The "X-Files" was recognized as one of the best shows on the air by the Viewers for Quality Television and also received the "Best Drama Series" at the Environmental Media Awards. It was nominated for two Emmys, Best Title Sequence and Best Music for a Title Sequence.

    For a listing of the people starring in this program, ClickCast. If you'd like a complete listing of all the episodes with the date that they were shown included, ClickThe X-Files Episode Guide.

    Return to list of questions.

Submitted January 30, 1995 for ICS 1C
